div.l: I pray to god so yeue me sorwe and care
If eủere sethe I hight ogge of ware
Herd I myller better sett on werke
He had a Iape of malice in the dirke
And ther fore if ya vouche saue to here
But god forbede that we stynte here
A tale of me that am a pore man
I wille you telle as well as eủery kan
A litill iape that fel in yoᵘur Cite
Houre hoste answerid I graunte that the
Now tell on Roger loke that hit be gode
¶ For many a pasty hast thou letyn blode
And many a Iacke of Douer hast thou solde
That hath ben twis hote and twis and colde
Of many a Pilgrime hast thou cristis curs
For of thi parcely yit fare I the wors a later hand has added "th" intralinearly to "For."
That they haue etyn with the stubbid gose
Fo in thi schop is many a flie lose
Nowe telle on Roger be thi name
But yit I pray the be nott wrothe for game
A man may sey ful sothe in game and pley
Thou seis ful sothe Roger be my fey
But sothe pley quade pley as the flemyng seith
And therfor harry balife be thi feithe
Be thou nought wrothe er we deꝑpartyn here
Thowe that my tale be of an ostelere
But natheles I wille nott telle it yit
But er we departe thou schall be quit
And ther with all he lough and made chere
And seide his prologe in this manere
A prentise whilom duellid in hour cite
And of crafte of vitaileris was he
Gailarde he was as goldfynche in the schawe
Broune as bery a proꝑper schort felawe
